caption: This is the best pizza I have had since I moved to Chicago. I'm from seattle and I gotta say I was not impressed by Chicago pizza. Its not that Seattle pizza is amazing or the best. Its just that I had high hopes for Chicago pizza. But I was not impressed until I found fat Chris's Detroit style pizza. This place is amazing !

As a born and bred Chicagoan, it is truly sacrilegious to say that any pizza from any other place, INCLUDING ITALY, is better than my home town's. Albeit, it's Detroit style and delicious but I believe if I had the same slice in the Motor City itself, it would have not been as good. It's not that Fat Chris makes a thick crust, mucho sauce, ample cheese with fresh toppings...It's good because it's made in Cook County. When I'm up that far North, I'm grabbing another pie.

Food ok. I asked if I could use a restroom, a lady behind the counter said that the owners don’t want customers there so I ordered and walk 2 blocks away to 7/11, a half block away. I think I won’t come here again; for food or restroom break:)
Pretty good Detroit style pizza.
Unbelievably good Detroit pizza. The crust is so crispy and chewing. The sauce had a nice little bit of sweetness to it. Tons of pizza for the price too!

Had this pizza for the first time yesterday and...thenagain today. First time I had Detroit style pizza as I grew up in Chicago. Delicious, love the crust and my 5 year old said it was his new favorite pizza too. Wait time was accurate both times we've ordered.

Perhaps they had an off day when it snowed , system was down, couldn't process a "paper" order but I called again and got my order in. Wings were fabulous, my 1st Detriot Style Pepperoni Pie was a bit well done. Charred crust versus carmelized. Could have used more tomato sauce. It is departure from other pizzas in Chicago. Will revisit this again for follow up review.

Found this gem just down the street from my new place and now it's become a fav!! Must order the "The Goods" pizza!! We ordered it with no black olives and added spinach, it was delicious!!! Worth every bite as you can see we started eating then said "omg, we need a pic for the review before we finish it all!! Lol No long wait time either! Also, the chubbies were delicious too 🤤 Warm and soft! Thanks Fat Chris's pizza! Will be back soon!
Their BBQ pizza is awesome. 👍👍
Great Detroit pizza and good sides but expect the wait times to be much longer than they tell you. Assume 15-30 minutes extra

I hate to leave a bad review about a local joint...but. The Pizza is delicious. However I’ve ordered from there two times. On both occasions I had to go back because the order wasn’t ready when they said it would be. The second time I had to go back twice until I finally canceled the order. I’d be hard-pressed to try it again.

Update on 1/27: I ordered the right pizza this time. The Detroit style is legit.  I'm leaving up my original (two-star) review below, because much of it still applies. But seriously, get make sure you get the Detroit style. It's so much better than their round, I don't even know why they make a round. It's the best I've had since moving to Chicago about six years ago. And yes, that includes Jet's. I like Jet's. But I like this better.  ---  Pretty disappointing. I'm new to the neighborhood and saw someone recommend Fat Chris's on Nextdoor. The photos reminded me of Buddy's back in the Detroit area. I ordered it for lunch.  The good news is it showed up early. The bad news is their online ordering is a train wreck. Every individual permutation of pizza size and type has its own listing, and none of them tell you what's actually on the pizza. In fact there are no descriptions at all. What's a 10" Samoa? A 14" Carnie? A Big Chris? Who knows! So what I wound up ordering (on accident) was a Domino's-quality medium round pizza with some boneless wings that were probably microwaved (no crunch at all), and a "Caesar salad" that was just a bowl of lettuce and cheese with with some underwhelming dressing.  I might give them another shot and make sure I get actual Detroit-style pizza, because there aren't many options for that in the area, but this initial offer doesn't inspire confidence.  tl;dr: expected Buddy's, got Domino's.
Ordered Detroit style - really good. If you want to support a local pizza place, try it!
Great food and staff is super friendly

Great Detroit style pizza! The Works was awesome.  The pepperoni rolls are also wonderful. I always expect pepperoni rolls to be too greasy or overfilled with cheese. These were not! They were pleasantly light and easy to eat.
Great pizza and I am not someone that normally cares about pizza.
Love and nice workers
Horrible service
Brilliant recipe for Detroit style pizza! Nice staff and easy pick up.

Not impressed with my first experience :/ My food was estimated to take 70-75 minutes to be delivered. That wasn't a problem because I assumed it was a busy night. My order arrived 20 minutes late and arrived with only 2 of the 3 items ordered. My salad was missing and the chubby (pepperoni roll) was cold. I tried calling the restaurant for a refund on my salad but was put on hold and then nobody ever picked back up. I tried calling 3 more times and the call wouldn't go through. Delivery man was very nice and apologetic. I understand it being a busy night and my delivery being delayed but my order should be complete before it is delivered.
Detroit Style Pizza flavor style very nice.  The cheese stretches like TMNT cartoon. Sometimes I just sit back and think about how good this pizza is.  Will be back.
Ordered 50$ worth of food. Received about 15$ worth, and exactly none of it was what I ordered. What arrived was uninspired and probably prepared from frozen. Pepperoni tasted cheap.
Love the detroit style pizzas and Chubbies

So disappointed to write this.  Every time we order delivery something goes wrong - burnt, wrong order, missing order items, and now undercooked and missing items again. I was hung up by the manager which is disappointing. He was upset I threw away the pizza after he stated he'd need to come pick it up from our home to issue a refund. Thankfully he did issue a refund after I said that was ridiculous. All we want to do is support local right now but bad service after multiple mistakes is not ok. I only wish them well but I am done ordering from what used to be our favorite neighborhood spot.
Incredibly delicious and well worth the wait. Lost interest in pizza, it all was so generic....until Fat Chris's. Once again a pizza fan...but ONLY for this pizza!!!!
My husband and I get chubbies every Tuesday! This place has made me a convert to detroit style pizza.
Favorite pizza in the area.
Love their detroit style pizza. When you can't just drop in to Buddy's in Hamtramck  this is the solution for getting a fix! Tip: order two smaller and get all corners!
Got takeout from Fat Chris's and I was quite impressed! This is the best Detroit-style pizza I've had in Chicago and I was very pleased. The pepperoni rolls were also fantastic. Will order again.
Bomb Detroit style pizza. Highly recommend 👌

A friend told me this place was really good!! Man, were they RIGHT!!! 😋👍🍕I have ordered this Detroit Style pizza; 5+ times since then! I crave this pizza!!! The chubbies are bomb too!! I gotta try the Stromboli next time I order. Not many places in Chicago have Stromboli or Detroit Style Pizza. I got my whole office to order Fat Chris’s and everyone LOVED the pizza! I never had great Detroit style pizza before this!! Wow!! Fat Chris’s is special!!! Keep up the amazing pizza pie making!! My wife likes her Detroit style pizza with the sauce on the side.
Anybody that gives this place five stars don't even have an idea what pizza should be like

Really good pizza. I'd never had Detroit style pizza before, but I'm a fan now. I like thick pizza but I think Chicago style is a little over the top. Detroit style strikes a happy medium. The sauce was extremely delicious. Just make sure you don't over order because it's hard not to eat it all. I also got some Stromboli which was just OK, but the pizza was very good! The people were very friendly which is not always a given anymore so points for that. Five stars is maybe too many it's more like 4.5 but with the shear volume of bad pizza places out there I think Fat Chris's deserves the 5 for being one of the good ones.

My fiancée and I were looking for a pizza place we hadn’t tried before and we super happy we landed on Fat Chris’s. The employees were so incredibly nice. And the pizza was easily top 5 in the city that we’ve had. We got the Detroit style and it was fantastic. Plus the prices are super reasonable. We’re definitely looking forward to getting pizza from them again.

Although the place is known for their Detroit style Pizza, they serve NY style thin crust along with stromboli and Calzones, and other things like salads, wings etc. Better order ahead as it takes 45 minutes to make the Detroit style. Also the only slices are thin crust variety. But it's really good. Nice neighborhood place. The thin crust is not as good as the Detroit style. But there's not that many places that do this style, so it's not a bad thing.
Awesome pizza by the slice
Our new favorite pizza place!!! We love the thin crust New York style. So flavorful! Don't forget to add cheesey sticks, they're freaking amazing.
Great Detroit style pizza.
Great pizza!!!
This place is bomb AF. Why would I ever need pizza again when chubbies exist?! Breadstick meets Bosco stick meets calzone equals handheld perfection. I love it.
Absolutely wonderful. Will definitely get again.
First time getting delivery from there. This is a damn good pizza, wow.

Large Goods Detroit style arrived on a Saturday night in an hour and was cold and too oily🤨... Only a ten minute drive too.. Nice quality ingredients though! Not enthusiastic about reordering, but fairly priced.  Ordered online directly from the restaurant.
God aweful pizza!!! 🤮🤮🤮🤮🤮🤮
WORST PIZZA EVER!!!!!!!!!!

Wish they can give you a correct pick up time on the delivery app. I experienced more than two different occasions when I step in to pick up the order according to the app time of pick up and i was told to come back on another 20-25 minutes.

Very rude manager or supervisor whatever she is! I was told to wait half an hour and i came in, the manager yells at me and says you have wait outside. I politely told it is my time to pick up and you told me to wait 30mnts. She dismisses me and made me wait another 20 mints. Good lucky ordering from here!
All the food is Amazing!!! My Personal favorite are the Chubbies and Detroit style. I definitely recommend this place. I drive 45 minutes just to pick up Fat Chris’s Pizza❤️

My New Favorite Place on Ubereats!!! I decided to try this place out to support the local during the pandemic. This place really blows my mind. All of this filling, delicious food just for $40 The pizza is thin slice, super cheesy and tasty. The wings are saucy, not so sweet with the BBQ sauce, very good with ranch. The chubbies are not that good, decent with ranch sauce. I love the cinnamon sticks!! Not too sweet and a hint of salty.

Don't attempt to order from them, there's always some excuse as to why they cannot complete your order and it is always someone else's fault. The pizza is fine but not worth the hassle of trying to get it delivered.

Had it delivered through GrubHub. I pre-ordered it for 6pm and it arrived on time and still warm. First time I've tried their food. It actually reminded me of the pizza my made when I was a kid, only hers was round. I got a 4 slice and a cherry strudel forgot to take a pic of the strudel but they were both very good. Would definitely order from them again.
The Detroit style pizza was very good. That's why we came. The four pictures of masked men on the wall was a puzzle loo e. None of the staff knew anything about them. Anybody??

Great pizza but they give very wrong times for pick up. This is the second time they’ve said 10 minutes and it took well over 25 minutes. I don’t care how long it’ll take I just want honest times as I only get a slice or two of pizza each time I’ve ordered. Pizza tastes great though.

THEIR FOOD IS SO GOOD.  Jump on the "chubbies" bandwagon, because it is a pizza-adjacent food that will change your life.  They are affordable and FORKING DELISH.  My friends and I get them several times a month -- they're just toooooo good to not have frequently. YUM.
I never had Detroit style pizza but this thin crust style is very good!! If Chicago is the King of pizza Detroit would be the Prince
Bad service very rude
Great Detroit style pizza!
The best Detroit style pizza in Chicago - love these folks
So delicious 😋
The pizza is so damn good but the prices are so damn high.
Favorite pizza place worst delivery ever... was 2 hours tonight and it’s still not here... I called and they didn’t even apologize or credit me.... complete bummer.... good pizza horrible service
I love the chubbies
Poor customer service and rude staff. Got my food 25 minutes after pick up time.
Great pizza, salads, and sandwiches.
This is by far our favorite pizza place. The Detroit style is amazing and the wings can't be beat. You will not regret giving this place a try.
If you want a Detroit style pizza and experience here in Chicago, this is the place to go!
I really enjoyed the Detroit style pizza from here. Perfectly cooked, and well proportioned toppings. Delicious!  Can't quit this pizza. It's really awesome.
Best place to buy something when in a hurry. Their customer service is fast, pricing is reasonable, good mood. Will come back again
The Cheese Sticks are very good. Would definitely recommend!
Delicious pizza with a crispy but soft crust. Go in the afternoon for all you eat pizza
Great Detroit pizza
Chubbies !!!
Without a doubt the best I've had in Chicago  !

Chicago has plenty of options for pizza, don't make the mistake of ordering from this place. My order was late, they forgot my salad, sent the wrong pizza (buffalo chicken instead of BBQ), and then they refused to give me a refund. They said they added store credit for the wrong pizza, but when I called back less than a month later, the manager said they had no record of it and I was out of luck. What a disappointment and waste of time and money! Better off going with Jets.

I live in the neighborhood and one day tried the hand tossed pizza - it was by far the best pizza I had had in the area!  And you know how the garlicy butter spread on the crust of a dominoes pizza is a bit like crack - it's just so good its really hard to stop? This pizza was like that, but better! But recently, the hand tossed pizza no longer comes with the seasoning on the crust - Why Fat Chris? Bring it back! It really made me want to order more pizza from you!
It was okay poor customer service,  very rude for business people to conduct themselves. Pizza is not all that. Stingy on the toppings. Buscemi
Terrific! I lived in Detroit and this REALLY is Detroit pizza. Perfect edge, right amount of cheese, tasty toppings and the sauce was authentic. Yea!
First time I tried Detroit - style pizza. It was excellent! Fat Chris's is an awesome place. I can't wait to go back!

My favorite pizza place in the world. I lived less than a mile away and now I'm much further and the thing I miss most is Fat Chris's Pizza and Such. When I am in town for business in December this will be my first stop.
Delicious pizza!!!
Amazing Detroit style pizza. The decor isn't much to talk about, but the relaxed vibes and wide variety of toppings certainly is.
Friendly staff, good pizza at a great price. Also they have Mountain Dew! What else could you want?
Loved the pizza!
Pizza is really good
Honestly my go to pizza place for a quick slice or two. $3 single slices NYC size and style and the chubby stuffed breadsticks are good too.  For dessert I suggest checking out the cherry strudel.
Tasty pizza and a really busy place for take out. We saw at least 10 delivery people come through while we ate or pizza. No discounts if you are fat and named Chris. Disappointing.
Pizza not the star attraction. Faygo and Bettermade chips rule the day.

Given there are only a few places in the city that serve Detroit style, my expectations were a little more elevated than if I were to be getting a Chicago style from, say, anywhere. I was disappointed with the end result. Visually, the pizza appeared a bit shallow for the Detroit pan variety. The flavor profile was bland. Pizza sauce was sweet and tasted like tomato paste with a little bit of added water and no seasoning. Another thing that struck me as odd was that it was served on a round tray too small for the pizza. It is clearly baked in a square pan and a permanent part of the menu. Are square serving trays hard to come by? Jets is better. The search continues.
Ordered delivery - came fast and hot! Our first time, loved it! Will order again.
I love the bread-y crust, and it was ready exactly when they said it would be!
Nice

Fat Chris’s Pizza is a high-grade! The Detroit pizza is very good, it has a crunchy crust with the right amount of sauce down the middle. Also, I got the cheese pizza sticks which were very good as well. It is the best place to hangout, looking forward to my next visit!
Loved the dough, cheese was good, sausage was meh, sauce is going to take another go around. I'm stuck between liking it any hating it. Really loved the dough though.
Our carry out order was phenomenal!  2 Detroit style pies and a Faygo.
Great pizza, expect long wait time

Extremely over priced and very low quality food.  I payed $30 for a 8 inch pizza and 8 tiny boneless wings.  I guess I wouldn't mind the cost of the food if it was delicious but it was anything but.  The wings were very dry, chewy, and mostly bread with little amounts of actual chicken.  The margarita pizza was bland and doughy and not worth the $17 for a single serve pizza.  If you want a cheaper pizza and wings with better quality order from dominos.
Loved the Detroit style pizza. The thick crust, great cheese and vandalized edges are wonderful. If you have not had Detroit style pizza you should try it!
Great pizza and even better customer service!
Family owned and great owners plus it’s my brothers and his amazing future wife’s place lol but a great place to go for a relaxing hangout sesh n grub .

Two words: pizza buffet! The lunch buffet goes until 2:30, and although they only put out a few pizzas at a time (Detroit and traditional styles), they take requests as well. If you're not looking to stuff yourself, they also have a great set-up for slices (traditional style). You can add whatever toppings you want, and it's ready in a few minutes. I wish more pizza joints would offer this.  It's a no-frills kind of place, but it's clean and the staff is great.
Phenomenal Detroit style, gluten-free pizza!
Local favorite

My first time trying Fat Chris'. I picked up my order. First impression; the restaurant is like going to a friend's house for pizza and hanging out.  Nothing fancy but comfortable. Staff friendly and welcoming. The detroit pizza very good. Crunchy crust with right amount of sauce down the middle. Also, got the cheese pizza sticks which were very good as well. Looking forward to my next visit.

This place is not reliable. You can get a great order once and then the next order is horrid.  With u see cooked crusts that are gummy. Take your chances but if your order isn’t right, don’t expect to have the place correct your order.  They don’t seem to care.
Delicious Detroit-style pizza.  I’ve never been a fan of the sauce-on-top kind of pizza, but the crust is to die for.  Great people, always had a good experience there
Best pizza you can find in this part of town. I’ll be ordering from here a lot more.

I got the Detroit style cheese pizza. The sauce was a little too sweet for my taste but it was good,  square slices and burnt edges. If I was in the neighborhood.(Andersonville), I'd definitely check this place out, but for somewhat similar fare, II'd definitely go for Pequods instead. The stuff is really solid though
Calzones! And delicious Detroit style 🍕
Best pizza I’ve ever had.
Had some delicious Detroit-style pizza from here. Great cheesy crispness on the crust with a flavorful sauce slathered on top.  I look forward to coming back during their acclaimed AYCE lunch buffet.
Quality Detroit style pizza with a friendly staff.

We had Detroit style pizza from here, based on the rave reviews. I dunno what the all the fuss is, because I found it barely better than frozen pizza. The sauce on top is pretty bland. If you want Detroit style that'll blow your mind, check out Longacre, and then tell me that's not better than Fat Chris's.
delicious pizza, big slices, big fan!

Buffet was great. They asked me if I had any preferences for pizza types and put what I requested out promptly. Buffet was mostly "normal" pizza with a couple Detroit style pies out too, and also their chubbies. Fresh and tasty - honestly can't complain a bit, other than price which I was happy to pay for the quality of pizza I got.
Got the buffalo chicken pizza, and cheese bread, a d both were delicious. Very Detroit styled, including Faygo pop, and Better Made chips. Definitely worth checking out.

Great Detroit style pizza. Came with my wife recently late afternoon on our way back to Chicago after a funeral service up north.  The crispy crust on the outside of the pizza is really nice. I cannot speak to their thin crust, but the Detroit style was something that will make us repeat customers. Recommended.
oh my god their Detroit style pizza is amazing

Super chill/relaxed atmosphere with a wonderful hostess.  Food options are plentiful.  Pizza crust was really crisp, but the sausage topping was only okay.  It's a viable option for pizza in Andersonville.
Love that. crunchy cheese on the bottom of the Detroit style pizza. BYOB,   friendly staff.
Pizza was very good. Cheesy. Sausage was tangy. Salad bar (at lunch) had a variety of choices. I would have liked more varied greens but the salad bar was good enough that I will return.
Great pizza and friendly owners and staff.   The chubbies are awesome.  Also, the breadsticks are the best I’ve ever had (not hyperbole).

A little heavy on the cheese, but you gotta love it. But other than that good authentic Detroit style. Needs more toppings, especially if it's 1.85. sauce is sweet but not sugary. All in all will return and go back. The sauce did stick on the cover, you may need a bigger box.
Delicious Buffalo chicken za, and the chubbies were perfection
The best pizza!!
Nice place to eat and the food is great!
Much like Buddy's in Detroit.  Good!
Amazing pizza.
For a cheap price you get excellent pizza and salad.
Hooked Huge slices for a great price. All the workers are really friendly and professional too
Great pizza slice size and buffet and pizza lunch deals
First time trying Detroit style pizza and really enjoy it.   The staff were nice and friendly.
No joke, get to this restaurant now.  Pizza is very different than typical, which is a very good thing.
Pizza by the slice!
This pizza is literally perfect
A bit pricey and I ordered mozzarella sticks and get what may as well have been thin pizza with lots of cheese ! The Detroit style pizza wasn't bad, very filling
Such good pizza

Ordered their Detroit style pizza for delivery tonight. Simply delicious! Held up very well for delivery, can't wait to take the experience when dining at their Foster Street location. Thicker dough was in good balance with the toppings. A unique feature was the strip of sauce located in the top of the pie. It allowed you to decide just how much sauce you wanted.

Service was good, but the food was pretty standard, but not solid. We got a chubbie, garlic parmesan sticks, and a Detroit style Herby. The chubbie was the best part and by itself would get 4 stars. The sticks were good, but I'd like more garlic on them. The pizza is where it fell apart for me. Overall it just didn't have any flavor or wow moments. The dough had a good crust on it with just the right crunch and flavor. However, when I bit into it, the dough just crushed too easily. It didn't have enough structure for me. The cheese was ok. The toppings just didn't have a lot of flavor and wasn't fresh. Pizza was hot but the toppings seemed cooler. And lastly the sauce just tasted like canned sauce with a flat flavor. There was no savoriness or herbs to it and it was balanced on the sweetness and acidic side.
Great food, Great service very clean family friendly
Great pizza and terrific people. I will be back.
Great staff n' zaaaaaa!!!

Detroit style pizza was on point, and the chubbies were an interesting concept that were amazing.  The only thing keeping this from 5 stars were the wings. We ordered both boneless and bone in and they were both very soggy, undercooked but not (raw undercooked). Wings should be very crispy, and the regular wings seemed like they were never crispy in the first place. Even baking them for 30 minutes didn't crisp either up. The sauce was also pretty  bland, they don't need to be insanely spicy but there should be a kick. Also for carryout and delivery orders wing sauce should be standard on the side to keep.them as crispy as possible.
Awesome people & GREAT food n' Zaaaa!!!
Good stuff and well priced

Went for the pizza buffet to try out Detroit style pizza. Did not disappoint. The owner/front line helpers were so kind, offering to make any type of pizza we wanted and tried to make sure we had a great experience and knew what type of pizza we were getting into. I’ll 100% be back soon.
Detroit style represent.  Totally underated pizza joint.  Get in before it gets discovered and a line forms out the door.
Friendly staff and the only Detroit-style pizza in the area that's not Jet's.  I really enjoyed it. The Chubby Rolls are delicious!
Great service! Loved the nachos and Pizza!! 😀
Uniquely scrumptious Detroit style pizza! Try the chubbies!

Ordered The Works, comes with 4 large crusty pieces with red sauce (looked like tomato paste) on top, pepperoni, Italian sausage, green peppers, mushrooms, black olives, banana peppers and a blend of cheeses.  I opted out of the banana peppers and olives for mine.  The all around crispy crust and fresh ingredients made it a standout in my book.  I now find myself madly in love with Detroit-style pizza!

A group of us ordered some gluten free pizzas to go. It was our first time having Fat Chris’s. They were delicious and we will definitely return in the future!  The crust reminded me of Pequod’s caramelized crust. So freaking good!

This pizza is an awesome take on deep-dish.  The lunch buffet is a fantastic deal since they bring out whatever you want.  It's probably safer that i live a few miles away, because I would definitely gain some serious (cheese-based) weight.
Best pizza in the neighborhood! Their Detroit style is excellent but so are the other options, including the lunch buffet. Staff is friendly and accommodating.
The detroit style pizza is so good! You can add toppings free of charge for a custom pie, such a great value. The owners are very helpful and friendly.
Delicious pizza by the slice, so much food for what you pay!
tasty neighborhood pizza
Amazing "Detroit Style" Pizza! Be sure to order bread sticks and Chubbys. The cinnamon bread is sweet doughy deliciousness.

I've tried this place a three times and I have mixed feelings about it. The nachos are decent and the Detroit style pizzas have a good flavor. The turnovers are kind of bland, as are the garlic sticks. Their online ordering process is a pain and they have forgotten something each time on my take out orders (marinara sauce, no cheese, etc.). I like having a different style pizza place as an option in Andersonville, but this place needs to step up their game.

Had this for the first time and was wowed. I had it delivery which is always risky but it was Sooo good! Pizza Tasted so fresh! The sauce is a truly unique flavor, cheese is delicious and fresh ingredients! Also the breadsticks were bomb!

First time here and I’m impressed!  The pan pizza is phenomenal. Didn’t know Detroit had its own style pizza but good on you Detroit. Great on you, Fat Chris, for bringing it to Andersonville!  Service was incredible.
Try the Chubbies - our favorite - and of course the Detroit-stlye pizza. The dough tastes so fresh!
Great food! Great service! Will be coming back again!

I have been to Fat Chris`s twice, first time I got the Detroit style. It was ok. No desire to get it again. Last time I got a thin. Was a little worse than a store bought Tombstone or Digiorno.  I eat pizza often.
Delicious Detroit style pizza. The Chubbies (pepperoni and cheese filled breadsticks) are amazing!
Ordered for pickup. Waited an additional 40 minutes once we got there for our food. Cashier was unsympathetic and said if we didn't want to wait we should just cancel it.
Great Detroit pizza! I got the fully loaded one and was very pleasantly surprised.

Can't rave about this place enough. The Detroit pan pizza is DELICIOUS. Every time we have it delivered, everyone around us asks about it. And everyone who works there is really wonderful. Have ordered many times and it's always a good experience. Do yourself a favor and go for it.
Excellent pizza. Excellent service.  Caramelized crust on the Detroit style was great.  Cooked a little more well done than people might be used to, but perfect for me!
Best Detroit style pizza we've had in Chicago...maybe ever!

The Detroit style pizza is very good. Almost seems more like intense cheesy bread w toppings rather than a typical pizza. Best part is the burnt end crust, love that style!  Cheese sticks are also good. Extremely cheesy! Perfect comfort food on a cold winter night.
Excellent Detroit style pizza. I highly recommend the Sunday buffet to get a taste of everything. If this isn’t on your Chicago pizza bucket list, it should be.
Great crust. Love their pizzas, and they have a really good Detroit style. The buffet is a lot of fun. The staff are wonderful. Really impressed with this place.
I've known these guys my whole life and their finally doing what they've always dreamed of doing I'm positive it is perfection I can not wait to experience it for myself
Some of the best pizza I have had in the city. And the appetizer that is called a chubby maybe the greatest creation ever

We were a group of 12 that came in 15 minutes before the end of the lunch buffet between Koval and Empirical tours...and the staff was very friendly and awesome! We all got fed quickly and they honored our lunch buffet, before we left, they told us we should take the extra pizza's they had already made. Which was incredible!
Love it here! I went for the first time last weekend with my mom and we got the deluxe pizza...it was awesome and the slices were huge!
The gluten free Detroit style pizza is not to be missed!  So full of flavor I cannot believe it is gluten free!!!  The cheese, sauce and toppings blend together so perfectly!!  Truly amazing!

Very friendly group of guys starting up a fun pizza place. They specialize in Detroit style pizza which features a thicker but very crispy crust lots of really tasty cheese ( I'm thinking Fontana or a moss/parm blend ) with rich sauce and usual toppings on top. They make  Very good stromboli. Lunch buffet is 11.00 with second one half off. All you can eat salad bar and variety of pizza selections plus pudding!! Good food good value. Byob

We stopped in for dinner.  Honestly wasn't expecting much based on photos from a friend on Facebook, with a big roll of brown paper towels on the table, but gotta say I was pleasantly surprised.  This is a no frills place....you order at the counter, it's BOYB and there are brown paper towels on the table (the kind you see in a bathroom dispenser).  That aside, the food is pretty good.  We ordered the Detroit style pizza, Chubbies (Pepperoni Rolls) and a Pizza Turnover.  Gotta say that when I saw Chubbies on the menu, the first thing that came to mind was something of a sexual nature, then mini pizza rolls.  Wrong on both accounts.  The Chubbies were actually big ass rolls filled with meat and cheese, covered in garlic.   We got the 6 to an order and only ate three between the 3 of us.  The pizza was very good as well.  We got "The Goods", Detroit style (cheese, red sauce, pepperoni, sausage, green peppers, black olives, and banana peppers).  For those you who don't know what that is, the pizza has a crust that is extra thick, yet super-crispy on the bottom. And it is square shaped.  In the days when I got this in the Motor City, these pizzas were cooked in industrial metal square pans that were used to hold metal parts.  Not sure if they are doing this here, but Fat Chris has gotten the crust right.  The crust is chewy and crunchy at the same time. Also the sauce is on the top and  I love it!  The turnover was nice too...I didn't get it but had a taste of my daughter's.  She got pepperoni and brisket.  I love the fact that Fat Chris let's you pick your toppings for the turnover.  Next time, I think I will get one with brisket, green peppers and onions.  Noticed that there were quite a few delivery guys in the joint, so I am thinking that they are going to make their business on take out.  Also wanted to point out they they do a lunch buffet...not sure if it is every day or Mon-Fri, but it is $11 (all you can eat pizza, salad and fountain drink), kids 6-11 are $6 and 5 and under eat free.  We had plenty of leftovers for lunch tomorrow.  They have desserts but didn't get to try those....next time. Also please get some real paper napkins.  Next time I will be bringing my own.
Good food, will return!!!!!!!

I'm a pizza fanatic and have tasted pizza all around Michigan AND Chicago and I must say the staff at Fat Chris's knows what they're doing! The cheese is something you won't taste in many of the mid grade quality pizza in Chicago-- delicious!
Had their Detroit style pizza in the restaurant and had the hand-tossed delivered. Both really good. Like that the default is a pie-cut slice for the hand-tossed. Staff at the store were really nice.

This place is great! With all the pizza places in Chicago, you have to have something unique to bring people in, and this place has it. I never knew what "Detroit-style" pizza was until now, but you have to try it, the carmelized cheese that spills over the crust is awesome. Don't forget to also try the "Chubbies" as well.
This is a great place, not to mention a delish eatery! Nick is awesome one of the owners. We work close by and our office orders for lunch,  everyone loves it! Classy and quality!
First time trying Detroit pizza. I thought it was good. Tried a few pies. Would like to go back and try their lunch buffet. A good amount to TVs with wide range of sports.

Holy delicious Detroit style pizza! We just tried this new, local, family-owned restaurant for the first time, and we're very happy! We tried The Hawaiian, and it did not disappoint. I'm looking forward to going back soon for lunch buffet.
Woah, that Detroit pizza was awesome! The sauce was great and the crust was so tasty. So glad this place exists and we have a new local pizza place. I am excited to try their lunch buffet now.

If you want to support a local family owned business, this is the one to throw your dollars at! The owners are there making sure everyone loves every bite. If not, they make it right. For the Michigan crowd in Chicago waiting for Detroit style that isn't Jets, this is it. Go check it out!
Great pizza with a gluten free crust option.
Great Detroit style pizza and friendly staff. Will definitely be back!
Really good pizza with great thicker crust pizza. Nice staff/owners and a good menu to choose from for comfort food pizza!

Loved the food especially the Detroit style can't wait to go back to try the world of pudding on their salad bar! Great service and wonderful working AC. Will definitely be back, great family spot to bring everyone.
Really great food but not great service. Sure it was due to a few kinks they have to work out. I would highly recommend it!
